I could not understand, why @coveralls complains about [this line](https://coveralls.io/builds/12098097/source?filename=libcloud%2Fcompute%2Fdrivers%2Fgce.py#L3207). Could anyone please help me with it?
However, the Travis CI build passed, and [coverage part](https://travis-ci.org/apache/libcloud/jobs/246077550) also passed.

I would like to pretty-much disable LXML, it breaks in so many scenarios, I've never been able to reproduce failing tests so I added a disable LXML flag in trunk (it might be in 2.0).
thoroughly support the test cases you added, the existing LXML test suite fails consistently.
@gargpankaj83 thanks for the contribution, the change set is showing as blank. I suspect that your second commit (the merge) reversed the original change. please check

Is this related to LIBCLOUD-921? The branch name suggests so.
The changes here to the base class are significant so I'd like to understand the issue in some more detail please.
üëç  thanks for the contribution
@ayleph thanks for your contribution. just one small change
thanks
this is much cleaner, that openstack driver could really use a spring-clean
thanks for the contribution üëç
@sT331h0rs3 ideally this would include a test (or another assertion) with the additional argument to the method. Then coveralls would be happy

in this case, I can see this is a harmless change, so other than slightly hurting our coverage % it's welcome üòÑ 

üëç

@johnnyWalnut this is a great change, I'm pretty sure I only tested Docker with non-secure configurations so it's not surprising that the implementation needs thinking through further. 

On the idea of setting a client-side request certificate in the instance. Absolutely, this makes more sense. Otherwise you'd be changing the settings for all driver instances (which doesn't make any sense). The client side certs got an overhaul in 2.0, so make sure you write some solid test cases for that
@johnnyWalnut I'd actually like that to be a separate PR and merge this one in if thats ok? one-change-per-PR
@hcarlsso you have trailing whitespace on 140 and 141
üëç  don't worry about coveralls for now
See #1039 for the lxml changes I made
@pquentin @allardhoeve  trying to stick with 1 change at a time, did this introduce any _new_ issues in OpenStack implementation?
Thanks a lot!
@tonybaloney Sure thing! Thanks for the feedback.

I guess`Use PyTest as the unit testing runner` should be removed, though?

Merging. Thanks for your contribution @jhelie
You're welcome - I'm obviously biased as one of the devs but if you found these useful you might want to give a go at [PR integration](https://lgtm.com/docs/lgtm/config/pr-integration) :)
that's a lot cleaner. I was also moving some tests to use assert instead of `self.assertTrue` etc.
Yeah. The assertTrue -> assert changes can be done using unittest2pytest. But I need to remove the unittest compatibility first.

I think we need a better fix here, this one probably works for now but is quite hacky and is likely to break in the future. The way args are passed to connections is brittle, it would be nice to fix that instead. But I do not know how to do it.

@tonybaloney There are other inconsistencies, should they be fixed too?

@pquentin I agree with your comment. Even I couldn't figure out a cleaner way to fix the problem. Do you think its worth pulling into the main trunk with some comments?

Its crashing otherwise for me and this temporarily fixes the problem?
Closing for now as it will take some time to be ready.

@tonybaloney I took your branch and https://github.com/SamuelMarks/libcloud/commit/53b2b93e0da024b2d1a19a25e7d1945622154358:
> Added params to tests; pytest-runner to deps; api_version; updated `_location_to_country`; implemented `ex_get_regions`

PS: Also in another branch I https://github.com/SamuelMarks/libcloud/commit/7d299f5eaa9b62a77b0120c6c60ad0eecbf9cb31
>  [azure_arm] [compute] [docs] Attempt at upgrading docs to new Azure CLI
üëç thanks for the contribution. This is a lot clearer.
üëç  thanks @fjros

well. yes there are inconsistencies, but they shouldn't necessarily be fixed. This a disagreement in the Python community, should `python setup.py install` install the dependencies for the package to execute _only_ or a full development environment.

I think they should be separate because you're probably installing from source and I don't want all of our users to have to install the dependencies we need for development (such as test runners and mockers).

But we are looking into test_requires here, which only applies to the test suite. `requests_mock` in the PR is being imported explicitly in multiple files and the test suite will just break without it installed.
I haven't tested these changes but in principle I don't have any objections.
ah ok yes that should be updated. @pquentin which other inconsistencies?
and @SamuelMarks with respect to caching, no libcloud doesn't have a caching mechanism. I had the same issue in testing, it takes a ridiculous amount of time to get full details about images.
